There are many issues you can report yourself directly to the council, or to other providers online or via apps on your phone.
FixMyStreet, Cheshire East Council
You can report issues directly to Cheshire East Council such as fly tipping, pot holes, street lights and many more issues to the Council using FixMyStreet
You can do this via the web site or download the FixMyStreet App using the app store on your phone. Find out more by downloading the FixMyStreet User Guide
Crewe Town Council Rangers
The Rangers can deal with issues such as litter picking, graffti removal, cutting trees hedges and shrubs as well as many other issues. You can report a problem using their online form.
Abandoned Shopping Trolleys
For most retailers including Morrisons you can report any abandoned shopping trolleys using the TrolleyWise app. Download this from the app store on your phone or you can also report online using the web site.
For ASDA trolleys you will need to use the Collex App, download this from your app store on your phone.
Guinness Housing
Call 0303 123 1890 Monday to Friday, 8am â€“ 8pm (and 24 hours a day, seven days a week, for emergency repairs and rent payments).
You can also contact online using the Guinness Partnership web site
Cheshire Police
If you wish to report a crime, please call your local police station, or in an emergency dial 999. Only dial 999 if:
- there is danger to life
- violence is used or threatened
- a serious crime is progressed or likely to occur
- a suspect for a serious crime is nearby
- there has been a road crash injuring someone or causing danger to others
- a person who is especially vulnerable needs assistance
The general telephone number for all non-emergency enquiries is 101.
E-mail: publiccontact@cheshire.pnn.police.uk
Report Anti Social Behaviour
You can report ASB by calling 101, or by using the online service
